entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 12 at 3:59PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...CONDITIONS HAVE IMPROVED IN THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA... Winds have diminished enough today to end the threat of widespread blowing and drifting snow in the Kuskokwim Delta.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 12 at 3:59PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AN ADVISORY HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR THE ALASKA PENINSULA... Steady snow has led to more persistent reductions in visibility due to blowing snow along the Alaska Peninsula. See the Winter Weather Advisory for more details.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 12 at 3:13PM AKST until December 12 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG DURATION HEAVY SNOW EVENT FOR THE KLONDIKE HIGHWAY NEAR WHITE PASS... A wave of moisture is moving through the northern panhandle Tuesday. With cold air in place, moderate to heavy snow is expected to continue through late Tuesday evening near White Pass.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 12 at 2:32PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Two to Four Inches of Snow Through Wednesday Afternoon... A band of snow just east of Fairbanks as of 4:30am Tuesday will push back to the west over the area west of Fairbanks from Murphy Dome to Tanana to Cantwell early Tuesday afternoon. Snow will linger through Wednesday afternoon. Two to four inches are expected, with the highest amounts along the Parks Highway south
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow and blowing snow.
